p: It has already been reported that an increase in CO 2 concentration to 550 ppm could increase the yields of rice, wheat, legumes, and oilseeds by 10–20%. However, a one degree increase in temperature may reduce the yields of wheat, soybean, mustard, groundnut, and potato by 3–7% [ 13]. An increase in temperature, as expected, would result in decreased water availability [ 31], and its impacts on agriculture would be crucial for India.
